caller_intent: Myrtle wanted to understand why her auto insurance rate increased by $13 after updating her garaging address and explore options to reduce the cost.
resolution_steps: Randy explained the $13 increase was due to the zip code change from updating the garaging address.
He presented a renter's policy option that would reduce the auto premium by $3 if purchased in full ($126/year for $25K coverage and $500K liability).
Agreed to delay adding the renter's policy until February 24th when the auto policy renews.
Randy committed to sending a quote for review before proceeding.
knowledge_required: Insurance rate factors (zip code, garaging address)
Renter's policy pricing and coverage details
Policy renewal timelines and discount structures
summary: Randy from Lions Insurance clarified a $13 auto insurance increase caused by a zip code change and offered a renter's policy discount. Myrtle agreed to wait until her February 24th auto policy renewal to add the renter's coverage, with a quote to be sent for review. The call resolved her concerns about the rate change and next steps.
